prompt:
A chat between a curious user and an artificial intelligence assistant. The assistant gives helpful, detailed, and polite answers to the user's questions. USER: Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<>>: $API <<>>: $CODE <<>>: $EXPLANATION. Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java? Please using this api: Arrays.stream. Answer:<<>>: Arrays.stream <<>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}; int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum(); <<>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation. Question: Extract text from html file using java: :I am working on a text crawler and I need to extract a certain text from several sites. I have used jsoup html parser:Document doc = Jsoup.connect("http://www.aljazeera.net/programs/behindthenews/2014/11/9/%D8%A3%D8%B3%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%A8-%D9%88%D8%AF%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%85%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AF%D8%A7%D9%85-%D8%A8%D8%AC%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D9%85%D8%B5%D8%B1").get();Elements ps = doc.select("p");String s = Jsoup.parse(ps.text()).text();PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter("newFile.txt", "UTF-8");out.write(s);out.close();This algorithm gets me an unwanted text, the wanted text is under this tag

And when I change my selection to Elements ps = doc.select("p dir=rtl");, it returns a compilation error.Is there any way to make it just select this wanted tag? Please using this api: PrintWriter.write. Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter("newFile.txt", "UTF-8");out.write(Jsoup.parse(ps.text()).text());out.close();
<<<explanation>>>: The Jsoup.parse() method returns a Document object, which can be converted to a string using the Jsoup.toString() method. The PrintWriter.write() method can then be used to write the string to a file. By calling Jsoup.parse() on the selected elements, you can extract the desired text without the need for a separate text parsing step.
